description:
'''Frank Ocean''' (born '''Christopher Edwin Breaux'''; October 28, 1987) is an American singer and songwriter. He has been credited by several [[music journalism|music critics]] as a pioneer of the [[alternative R&B]] genre. Ocean has won two [[Grammy Award]]s and a [[Brit Awards|Brit Award]] for [[Brit Award for International Male Solo Artist|International Male Solo Artist]], among other [[List of awards and nominations received by Frank Ocean|accolades]]; both of his studio albums have been listed on ''[[Rolling Stone]]''{{'}}s "[[Rolling Stone's 500 Greatest Albums of All Time|500 Greatest Albums of All Time]]" (2020).

Ocean began his musical career as a [[ghostwriter]] until joining the Los Angeles-based [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] collective [[Odd Future]] in 2010. The year prior, he signed with record producer [[Tricky Stewart]]'s [[RedZone Entertainment]], an imprint of [[Def Jam Recordings]], although his debut [[mixtape]], ''[[Nostalgia, Ultra]]'' (2011), was released independently. His debut [[studio album]], the eclectic ''[[Channel Orange]]'' (2012), incorporated elements of [[alternative R&B|R&B]] and [[soul music]]. At the [[55th Annual Grammy Awards]], the album was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year|Album of the Year]] and won [[Grammy Award for Best Urban Contemporary Album|Best Urban Contemporary Album]]; its lead single, "[[Thinkin Bout You (Frank Ocean song)|Thinkin Bout You]]", was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year|Record of the Year]]. He was named by ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' as one of the world's [[Time 100|most influential people]] in 2013.

After a four-year hiatus, Ocean released the [[visual album]] ''[[Endless (Frank Ocean album)|Endless]]'' (2016) to fulfill contractual obligations with Def Jam. His second studio album, ''[[Blonde (Frank Ocean album)|Blonde]]'', was released [[independent music|independently]] the following day. Expanding on Ocean's experimental approach, ''Blonde'' was met with critical acclaim, debuted atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], and ranked first on ''[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]]''{{'s}} Best Albums of the 2010s Decade list. After 2017, Ocean has released sporadic singles, worked as a photographer for magazines, launched the fashion brand [[Homer (brand)|Homer]], and started ''Homer Radio''. 15 of Ocean's songs have entered the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], while four of his releases (singles or albums) have received [[RIAA certification|platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA).
